info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 02 at 4:28PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A rain and snow squall will affect portions of southern Lewis and Clark, southwestern Broadwater, northern Madison and Jefferson Counties through 515 PM MDT... At 425 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a rain and snow squall, about 13 miles southwest of Helena, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect a period of rain and snow as the squall moves through, along with a brief period of wind gusts around 40 mph. Visibility could fall below a quarter of a mile for a short time in heavier periods of snow. Locations impacted include... Helena, Boulder, Lincoln, East Helena, Whitehall and Montana City. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 135 and 234. Interstate 90 between mile markers 235 and 273. Highway 12 between mile markers 29 and 57. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If driving, be prepared for areas of poor visibility.
